conclusion: Determine the electric field at point A using superposition and properties of electric fields.
Distance between charges 2q and -q is L; electric field due to point charge Q at distance r is E = kQ/r^2.
Electric field at midpoint O due to charge 2q is E_{2q} = 4kq/L^2.
Electric field at midpoint O due to charge -q is E_{-q} = -4kq/L^2.
Total electric field at O is E = |E_{2q} + E_{-q}| = 0, but problem states magnitude is E.
Vertical components of fields cancel out; horizontal components add up.
Magnitude of electric field at O is E = 4√2kq/L^2.
Given E = 4√2kq/L^2, use this to find electric field at point A.
Distance from charge 2q to point A is √2L; distance from charge -q to point A is √2L.
Electric field due to charge 2q at point A is E_{2q,A} = kq/L^2.
Electric field due to charge -q at point A is E_{-q,A} = -kq/2L^2.
Total electric field at A is E_A = √(k^2q^2/L^4 + k^2q^2/4L^4) = √5kq/2L^2.
